attributes.action: Introduce Preference Voting System in UK Elections
attributes.additional_details: Many people who don’t vote are nonetheless interested in politics and even support a political party, but don’t vote because they feel their vote would be wasted. Preference Voting allows you to vote in any which way suits you and still ultimately make your vote count.
attributes.background: UK’s elections are flawed and outdated. In order to install more faith in the election process the UK needs to reform its election process. Implementing a Preference voting system will raise voting turnout and interest in the election process.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise.  Decisions on some elections are taken by the relevant devolved parliaments.

We could accept a petition calling for a change to General Elections or elections in England, depending on which you'd like to see.
